page.title: 10Wildlife
page.content: We invited Mr.D. Acland along to give a talk to our 4th year on plants and birds in our area. He was very enthusiastic about the subject and gave us some tips on how to go about our research. Guide books are essential and try to do your homework first. Trees and flowers can be compared with pictures and writing by looking at leaves, flowers, fruit, bark etc. Birds are more difficult, so you must act like a detective by asking questions and eliminating suspects. Some things to consider are : (a) size (b) shape (c) behaviour (d) flight (e) markings (f) call/song (g) habitat (h) time of year Never be afraid to say "I don't know" and take notes.{Do not harm the {wildlife or the countryside.}
